channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: There's no shortage of finals intrigue on Friday night as the Sharks and Knights battle to shore up a top-eight spot before the red-hot Rabbitohs face Melbourne.
item.title: NRL 2020 LIVE: Knights v Sharks and Rabbitohs v Storm

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: National cabinet has fractured over plans to ease state border controls and open the economy by Christmas, with premiers pushing back at a bold federal agenda out of concern it could erode their power.
item.title: Premiers split over roadmap to coronavirus recovery

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: Passengers and crew on superyacht fined by police for breaching exemption to COVID-19 restrictions as they sailed from Melbourne.
item.title: Lady Pamela passengers and crew fined in NSW and Queensland

item.dc:creator: Julia Baird
item.description: The sordid stories involving an American preacher and his wife have rocked evangelical America. Whether they will rock the US election is not so clear.
item.title: Getting devout and dirty: will the Falwells' fall from grace hurt Trump's evangelical vote?

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Heavily armed police, carrying guns and shields, took up position outside a home in Henry Street, Lewisham.
item.title: Man dies, another critical following shooting in Sydney's inner west

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: National cabinet was unable to come to a unanimous agreement to create a national coronavirus hotspot definition to reopen borders.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Scott Morrison reveals national cabinet to no longer operate on consensus basis as Victoria records 81 new COVID-19 cases; Australian death toll jumps to 737

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Australians have shown that they care more about saving lives than saving the bottom line.
item.title: Lives come before jobs but the economy needs to restart

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Swifts coach Briony Akle says some players are starting to feel homesick, but the team is more determined than ever to take out the premiership once again.
item.title: Hub life takes toll but Swifts set on seeing out Sunshine State stay

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The council that runs Australia's award system decided that without legal findings against either commentator, they had not brought the order into disrepute.
item.title: Bettina Arndt, Mike Carlton to keep Order of Australia honours

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Mark McGowan says WA hard border will stay up until community transmission eliminated in eastern states.
item.title: WA to go its own way on pandemic plan as rest of nation joins forces on borders

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: Richmond star Shane Edwards said he felt like a spectator training with Geelong champion Gary Ablett in Queensland quarantine.
item.title: Edwards in awe of rival Ablett at transition hub training

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Alex de Minaur is into his third consecutive US Open third round despite a late comeback from French veteran Richard Gasquet.
item.title: Gasquet rally can't keep de Minaur from US Open third round

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Nationals' seats at-risk in the lead up to the 2019 state election gained substantial sums from a grants scheme for rural and regional areas.
item.title: Coalition seats big winners from state's council grants scheme

item.description: A 45-year-old man is the latest person arrested for failing to comply with a self-quarantine direction after returning to Western Australia.
item.title: Perth man the latest to face charges over alleged quarantine breaches

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Crown Resorts executives approved the transfer of $500,000 to a Melbourne drug dealer after being told that he was a 'good friend' of one of the casinoâ€™s junket business partners.
item.title: Crown sent $500,000 to drug dealer who was 'good friend' of junket

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Should Cameron Smith play on, coach Michael Maguire looms as the Wests Tigers' big trump card to keep Harry Grant.
item.title: Why Harry's Wild About Madge: Tigers coach best hope of keeping rake

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: A cluster of children fell sick with the disease in the United Kingdom. Now a case has been detected in Melbourne.
item.title: Boy in Melbourne hospital battling rare coronavirus-related illness

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Cricket Australia says the NSW government had given permission for the WBBL to be played out of Sydney - the city's first COVID-19 sports hub.
item.title: Sydney COVID-19 hub to host entire WBBL season

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Network Ten's former executive producer of entertainment, Maria Michael, says she is owed almost $400,000 in redundancy pay.
item.title: Former Network Ten producer launches legal action against company

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: The sale process marks the return of Australia's second carrier, which had been facing the prospect of complete shutdown and liquidation if no willing bidder was found.Â
item.title: Virgin relaunch secured but COVID-19 risks still loom over workforce

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The local bourse shed $56b on Friday, eroding two buoyant days with a 3.1 per cent plunge that marked the benchmark's worst performance since May 1.
item.title: Tech stocks suffer as US bloodbath spreads to ASX

item.description: Itâ€™s another strong day of group racing at headquarters and Brad Gray of Racing NSW has you covered for Saturday's program.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Randwick on Saturday

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: The head of Australia's biggest bank calls for ongoing government stimulus and predicts a long and uneven economic recovery.
item.title: CBA chief Comyn says end of JobKeeper will be economy's biggest challenge

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: The Prime Minister has powerful levers to influence the states. The question is whether he will use them.
item.title: Morrison has to choose whether to force the economy open

item.description: "These [signs of breathing and pulse] along with the temperature sensor means there is a possibility of life," a rescue worker said.
item.title: Rescue dog detects pulse in rubble a month after Beirut port blast

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Officers visited a home in Rossville, about 145 kilometres north-west of Cairns, just before 10am on Friday where the discovery was made.
item.title: Crime scene declared after body of man, child found in far north

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Coach Alastair Clarkson said it was hard to judge why the Hawks have been so poor in this unusual season.
item.title: We don't think we're miles away: Clarkson

item.dc:creator: Katina Curtis
item.description: Two-thirds of surveyed staff working at the NDIS watchdog don't believe it can effectively investigate complaints or reported incidents.
item.title: NDIS watchdog to get more staff, funding as workers head 'towards burnout'

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: The captain of a superyacht who sailed from Victoria to Queensland with passengers including a Melbourne millionaire has been charged with making a false border declaration.
item.title: Lady Pamela skipper headed to court after cross-border journey

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: The world-first, LNG-fuelled, 209 deadweight tonnage Newcastlemax bulk carriers were expected to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by about 30 per cent compared to their diesel cousins.
item.title: BHP to build world's first fleet of gas-powered iron ore carriers for the Pilbara

item.description: A Portuguese hacker whose explosive revelations about European soccer embarrassed players, clubs and officials is fighting to stay out of jail.
item.title: Trial to decide if Football Leaks hacker is hero or villain

item.dc:creator: Scott Spits
item.description: Tennis Australia has supported the stance taken by US Open officials to subject close contacts of French player Benoit Paire, who returned a positive COVID-19 test, to additional restrictions in New York.
item.title: Tennis Australia endorses double bubble at US Open

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: No government in the world has avoided economic turmoil because of the coronavirus pandemic. The test is how they extricate themselves from its impact.
item.title: How to move out of recession? The tough decisions are ahead

item.description: Joe Biden's trip to Kenosha came two days after President Donald Trump travelled to the city, the site of sometimes violent protests since Blake was shot.
item.title: Joe Biden speaks with Jacob Blake, Kenosha residents on visit to city

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: The head of supermarket giant Coles has warned inner-city retail could be seriously weakened by COVID-19 for years as many Australians will continue to work from home and it's unclear to what extent students and tourists will flock back to CBDs.
item.title: Inner-city stores could be feeling pandemic pain for years: Coles boss

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Australia's biggest bank bosses are gearing up for a surge in failing companies when government supports are withdrawn.
item.title: Banking bosses prepare for jump in businesses failing

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: A former drug counsellor has been jailed for more than a decade for brazen offending that included providing clients with clean urine samples in exchange for cash and drugs.
item.title: 'Mole' in the legal system: Jail for counsellor who swapped clean samples for drugs

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: A second survivor was found floating unconscious on Friday morning and taken to hospital, but later died.
item.title: 'A serious disaster': Ship rescue crews race against second Typhoon

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Gladstone Water Police Sergeant Jeff Barnett said the two men involved were well-known amateur fishermen and friends.
item.title: Fisherman dies in boating accident, survivor swims 40 minutes to shore for help

item.dc:creator: Ben Schneiders
item.description: Leaked tapes show that much of a national executive meeting of the CFMMEU on Friday was taken up with debate over a resolution on misogyny.
item.title: 'Not some misogynist pig': Union chief John Setka defends accusations of sexism

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: The Tigers coach faced reporters on Friday amid a turbulent week at the club, following reports he has lost the dressing room due to his tough style of coaching.
item.title: Marshall axing 'definitely' toughest decision of Maguire's career

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Jamie Whincup won two of the three races at Townsville last weekend but cannot rely on the same set-up this weekend as other teams will have learned and be faster.
item.title: Car set-up crucial to faster performance, says Whincup

item.dc:creator: Helen Pitt
item.description: Sydney City Councillor Jess Scully returns to Fairfield, the suburb where she spent her childhood, to discuss her new book, Glimpses of Utopia.
item.title: Jess Scully: is this the face of Sydney's next Lord Mayor?

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: The NSW Health decision came as all states, with the exception of Western Australia, agreed to consider lifting hard borders by December at Friday's national cabinet meeting.
item.title: Queensland defiant on border, as NSW Health advises to avoid aged care homes on Father's Day

item.dc:creator: Jake Wilson
item.description: This week, a quintet of films about buttoned-down guys with more possibilities than you might suppose.
item.title: Top 5 films: the best of what's new in streaming

item.description: Director Maryam Touzani uses a grandmother's cake recipes as a metaphor in Adam, a gentle movie that tackles unmarried motherhood in a restrictive society.
item.title: Baking is the recipe for healing in a new Moroccan film

item.dc:creator: Craig Mathieson
item.description: Jarv Is' Beyond the Pale, Thibault's Or Not Thibault, Alister Spence's Whirlpool and Disclosure's Energy,
item.title: Music reviews: Jarv Is, Disclosure, Alister Spence and Thibault

item.description: TV star Alan Davies has written a memoir about the abuse and pain of his childhood. But when it comes to an interview, he doesn't want to discuss it.
item.title: Actor Alan Davies on why he won't talk about 'the A-word'

item.description: S.L. Lim's second novel is written with elegance and restraint.
item.title: Fiction reviews: Revenge - Murder in Three Parts and three more titles
